original_table_html:
| Question | Prompt                                                                                  |
|----------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 13-23    | What is retail convergence? Has it helped or harmed small retailers?                    |
| 13-24    | Describe the types of shopping centers and identify specific examples in your community or a nearby city. | In this and the next three chapters, we’ll examine the last of the marketing mix tools—promotion.
summary_markdown: This table presents two distinct questions related to retail and marketing. The first question, 13-23, probes the concept of "retail convergence," asking for its definition and an assessment of its impact, specifically whether it has benefited or disadvantaged small retailers. The second question, 13-24, shifts focus to the physical aspects of retail, requesting a description of different types of shopping centers and the identification of local or regional examples. The text accompanying question 13-24 also provides context, indicating that the subsequent three chapters will delve into the "promotion" element of the marketing mix.
